meanings.definition: relating to the flow of matter
meanings.sent1: The rheologic properties of the liquid affected its movement through the pipe.
meanings.sent2: The scientist conducted a rheologic analysis to understand how the substance moved.
meanings.sent3: The rheologic behavior of the slime made it challenging to clean up after the prank.
meanings.sent4: Her dance was like a rheologic performance, fluid and graceful.
meanings.sent5: The artist used colors to represent the rheologic nature of the river, capturing its smooth flow.

meanings.definition: the study of the flow of matter
meanings.sent1: In her research, she delved deep into the world of rheologic to understand fluid dynamics.
meanings.sent2: The textbook on rheologic provided valuable insights into how materials move.
meanings.sent3: The class on rheologic turned out to be more interesting than expected, with hands-on experiments.
meanings.sent4: His passion for rheologic led him to pursue a career in fluid mechanics.
meanings.sent5: The professor's enthusiasm for rheologic made the subject come alive for the students.
